segment.source: Add Language Packs to Windows
segment.target: Add Language Packs to Windows

segment.source: Add Language Packs to Windows
segment.target: Add Language Packs to Windows

segment.source: Add Language Packs to Windows
segment.target: Add Language Packs to Windows

segment.source: OEMs can add language packs to localize PCs and devices for customers in different regions.
segment.target: OEMs can add language packs to localize PCs and devices for customers in different regions.

segment.source: For Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education), language packs have been split into language components and Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).
segment.target: For Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education), language packs have been split into language components and Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).

segment.source: This reduction in image size can be helpful when creating images for lower-cost devices with small storage.
segment.target: This reduction in image size can be helpful when creating images for lower-cost devices with small storage.

segment.source: It can also reduce the time required to create and deploy images.
segment.target: It can also reduce the time required to create and deploy images.

segment.source: Language Pack Types
segment.target: Language Pack Types

segment.source: You can install multiple languages onto the same Windows 10 image.
segment.target: You can install multiple languages onto the same Windows 10 image.

segment.source: For each language, where available:
segment.target: For each language, where available:

segment.source: Add the language pack and the Basic components.
segment.target: Add the language pack and the Basic components.

segment.source: To preload Cortana features, also add the Text-to-speech, and Speech recognition.
segment.target: To preload Cortana features, also add the Text-to-speech, and Speech recognition.

segment.source: Add Fonts and Optical character recognition for the most popular languages within a region to improve your user’s first experience (strongly recommended).
segment.target: Add Fonts and Optical character recognition for the most popular languages within a region to improve your user’s first experience (strongly recommended).

segment.source: If they’re not already installed, Windows downloads and installs them in the background when the user chooses that language for the first time.
segment.target: If they’re not already installed, Windows downloads and installs them in the background when the user chooses that language for the first time.

segment.source: Add handwriting recognition for devices with pen inputs.
segment.target: Add handwriting recognition for devices with pen inputs.

segment.source: Add Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) components so that end users can more easily recover their PCs.
segment.target: Add Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) components so that end users can more easily recover their PCs.

segment.source: Other customizations that can be preset:
segment.target: Other customizations that can be preset:

segment.source: Currency, time zone, or calendar formats
segment.target: Currency, time zone, or calendar formats

segment.source: Keyboard Identifiers and Input Method Editors for Windows
segment.target: Keyboard Identifiers and Input Method Editors for Windows

segment.source: Not all capabilities are available for every language.
segment.target: Not all capabilities are available for every language.

segment.source: Use care to limit the amount and types of language packs included with each image.
segment.target: Use care to limit the amount and types of language packs included with each image.

segment.source: While the Windows 10 language packs are smaller, having too many can still affect disk space, and can affect performance, especially while updating and servicing Windows.
segment.target: While the Windows 10 language packs are smaller, having too many can still affect disk space, and can affect performance, especially while updating and servicing Windows.

segment.source: Some capabilities have additional dependencies, as shown in the following table.
segment.target: Some capabilities have additional dependencies, as shown in the following table.

segment.source: Component
segment.target: Component

segment.source: Sample file name
segment.target: Sample file name

segment.source: Dependencies
segment.target: Dependencies

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Language pack
segment.target: Language pack

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: UI text, including basic Cortana capabilities.
segment.target: UI text, including basic Cortana capabilities.

segment.source: Language interface pack
segment.target: Language interface pack

segment.source: Requires a specific fully-localized or partially-localized language pack.
segment.target: Requires a specific fully-localized or partially-localized language pack.

segment.source: Example: ca-ES requires es-ES.
segment.target: Example: ca-ES requires es-ES.

segment.source: To learn more, see Available Language Packs for Windows.
segment.target: To learn more, see Available Language Packs for Windows.

segment.source: UI text, including basic Cortana capabilities.
segment.target: UI text, including basic Cortana capabilities.

segment.source: Not all of the language resources for the UI are included in a LIP.
segment.target: Not all of the language resources for the UI are included in a LIP.

segment.source: LIPs require at least one language pack (or parent language).
segment.target: LIPs require at least one language pack (or parent language).

segment.source: A parent language pack provides support for a LIP.
segment.target: A parent language pack provides support for a LIP.

segment.source: The parts of the UI that are not translated into the LIP language are displayed in the parent language.
segment.target: The parts of the UI that are not translated into the LIP language are displayed in the parent language.

segment.source: In countries or regions where two languages are commonly used, you can provide a better user experience by applying a LIP over a language pack.
segment.target: In countries or regions where two languages are commonly used, you can provide a better user experience by applying a LIP over a language pack.

segment.source: Basic
segment.target: Basic

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Spell checking, text prediction, word breaking, and hyphenation if available for the language.
segment.target: Spell checking, text prediction, word breaking, and hyphenation if available for the language.

segment.source: You must add this component before adding any of the following components.
segment.target: You must add this component before adding any of the following components.

segment.source: Fonts
segment.target: Fonts

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Fonts.
segment.target: Fonts.

segment.source: Required for some regions to render text that appears in documents.
segment.target: Required for some regions to render text that appears in documents.

segment.source: Example, th-TH requires the Thai font pack.
segment.target: Example, th-TH requires the Thai font pack.

segment.source: To learn more, see Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).
segment.target: To learn more, see Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).

segment.source: Optical character recognition
segment.target: Optical character recognition

segment.source: Basic
segment.target: Basic

segment.source: Recognizes and outputs text in an image.
segment.target: Recognizes and outputs text in an image.

segment.source: Handwriting recognition
segment.target: Handwriting recognition

segment.source: Basic
segment.target: Basic

segment.source: Enables handwriting recognition for devices with pen input.
segment.target: Enables handwriting recognition for devices with pen input.

segment.source: Text-to-speech
segment.target: Text-to-speech

segment.source: Basic
segment.target: Basic

segment.source: Enables text to speech, used by Cortana and Narrator.
segment.target: Enables text to speech, used by Cortana and Narrator.

segment.source: Speech recognition
segment.target: Speech recognition

segment.source: Basic, Text-To-Speech recognition
segment.target: Basic, Text-To-Speech recognition

segment.source: Recognizes voice input, used by Cortana and Windows Speech Recognition.
segment.target: Recognizes voice input, used by Cortana and Windows Speech Recognition.

segment.source: WinRE
segment.target: WinRE

segment.source: Multiple, see Customize Windows RE.
segment.target: Multiple, see Customize Windows RE.

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Used to help end users repair and recover their PCs.
segment.target: Used to help end users repair and recover their PCs.

segment.source: See Customize Windows RE.
segment.target: See Customize Windows RE.

segment.source: Where do I download the language packs?
segment.target: Where do I download the language packs?

segment.source: OEMs and system builders can get the packages and features from dedicated download centers for OEMs and System Builders.
segment.target: OEMs and system builders can get the packages and features from dedicated download centers for OEMs and System Builders.

segment.source: Users can install more languages and features by going to SettingsTime & languageRegion & languageAdd a language.
segment.target: Users can install more languages and features by going to SettingsTime & languageRegion & languageAdd a language.

segment.source: To learn more, see How to add an input language to your PC.
segment.target: To learn more, see How to add an input language to your PC.

segment.source: To see what's available, see Available Language Packs for Windows.
segment.target: To see what's available, see Available Language Packs for Windows.

segment.source: Other considerations
segment.target: Other considerations

segment.source: Some languages require more hard-disk storage space than others.
segment.target: Some languages require more hard-disk storage space than others.

segment.source: Although you can add a bunch of language packs at once using the commands: DISM /Add-Package, DISM /Apply-Unattend, or LPKSetup, don't add too many at once, because the device may not have enough memory to handle it.
segment.target: Although you can add a bunch of language packs at once using the commands: DISM /Add-Package, DISM /Apply-Unattend, or LPKSetup, don't add too many at once, because the device may not have enough memory to handle it.

segment.source: General recommendations: from Windows in audit mode, don't add more than 20 language packs at a time.
segment.target: General recommendations: from Windows in audit mode, don't add more than 20 language packs at a time.

segment.source: From Windows PE, don't add more than 7.
segment.target: From Windows PE, don't add more than 7.

segment.source: If WinPE is still running out of memory, you can customize WinPE by adding temporary storage (scratch space).
segment.target: If WinPE is still running out of memory, you can customize WinPE by adding temporary storage (scratch space).

segment.source: Cross-language upgrades are not supported.
segment.target: Cross-language upgrades are not supported.

segment.source: This means that during upgrades or migrations, if you upgrade or migrate an operating system that has multiple language packs installed, you can upgrade or migrate to the system default UI language only.
segment.target: This means that during upgrades or migrations, if you upgrade or migrate an operating system that has multiple language packs installed, you can upgrade or migrate to the system default UI language only.

segment.source: For example, if English is the default language, you can upgrade or migrate only to English.
segment.target: For example, if English is the default language, you can upgrade or migrate only to English.

segment.source: The default language cannot be removed because it is used to generate computer security identifiers (SIDs).
segment.target: The default language cannot be removed because it is used to generate computer security identifiers (SIDs).

segment.source: The default UI language is the language that is selected during the Out-Of-Box-Experience (OOBE), the UI language specified in the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) command-line tool, or in the unattended answer file if you skip OOBE.
segment.target: The default UI language is the language that is selected during the Out-Of-Box-Experience (OOBE), the UI language specified in the Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) command-line tool, or in the unattended answer file if you skip OOBE.

segment.source: To add language packs using Windows PE, you may need to add pagefile support to Windows PE.
segment.target: To add language packs using Windows PE, you may need to add pagefile support to Windows PE.

segment.source: For more information, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices.
segment.target: For more information, see Deployment Image Servicing and Management (DISM) Best Practices.

segment.source: Do not install a language pack after an update.
segment.target: Do not install a language pack after an update.

segment.source: If you install an update (hotfix, general distribution release GDR, or service pack SP) that contains language-dependent resources before you install a language pack, the language-specific changes that are contained in the update are not applied and you will need to reinstall the update.
segment.target: If you install an update (hotfix, general distribution release GDR, or service pack SP) that contains language-dependent resources before you install a language pack, the language-specific changes that are contained in the update are not applied and you will need to reinstall the update.

segment.source: Always install language packs before installing updates.
segment.target: Always install language packs before installing updates.

segment.source: The version of the language pack must match the version of Windows.
segment.target: The version of the language pack must match the version of Windows.

segment.source: For example, you can't add a Windows 10 language pack to Windows 8, or add Windows 8 language pack to Windows 10.
segment.target: For example, you can't add a Windows 10 language pack to Windows 8, or add Windows 8 language pack to Windows 10.

segment.source: The build number must also match.
segment.target: The build number must also match.

segment.source: Installation methods
segment.target: Installation methods

segment.source: You can add a language pack to an image in the following ways:
segment.target: You can add a language pack to an image in the following ways:

segment.source: Offline installation .
segment.target: Offline installation .

segment.source: If you need to add a language pack or configure international settings on a custom Windows image, you can use DISM.
segment.target: If you need to add a language pack or configure international settings on a custom Windows image, you can use DISM.

segment.source: Using Windows Setup.
segment.target: Using Windows Setup.

segment.source: On a running operating system.
segment.target: On a running operating system.

segment.source: If you need to boot the operating system to install an application or to test and validate the installation, you can add a language pack to the running operating system by using DISM or the language pack setup tool (Lpksetup.exe).
segment.target: If you need to boot the operating system to install an application or to test and validate the installation, you can add a language pack to the running operating system by using DISM or the language pack setup tool (Lpksetup.exe).

segment.source: You can use this method only for language packs that are stored outside of the Windows image.
segment.target: You can use this method only for language packs that are stored outside of the Windows image.

segment.source: For more information, see Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation and Add Language Interface Packs to Windows.
segment.target: For more information, see Add and Remove Language Packs on a Running Windows Installation and Add Language Interface Packs to Windows.

segment.source: Add or remove languages using Windows Setup
segment.target: Add or remove languages using Windows Setup

segment.source: To deploy a multilingual edition of Windows by using Windows Setup
segment.target: To deploy a multilingual edition of Windows by using Windows Setup

segment.source: Add or remove language packs in the Langpacks folder in a distribution share.
segment.target: Add or remove language packs in the Langpacks folder in a distribution share.

segment.source: Recreate the Lang.ini file.
segment.target: Recreate the Lang.ini file.

segment.source: Windows Setup uses the Lang.ini file to identify the language packs that are inside the image and in the Windows distribution share.
segment.target: Windows Setup uses the Lang.ini file to identify the language packs that are inside the image and in the Windows distribution share.

segment.source: The Lang.ini file also identifies the language that is displayed during Windows Setup.
segment.target: The Lang.ini file also identifies the language that is displayed during Windows Setup.

segment.source: You must also regenerate the Lang.ini file if you plan to create recovery media for images that contain multiple languages.
segment.target: You must also regenerate the Lang.ini file if you plan to create recovery media for images that contain multiple languages.

segment.source: You can use DISM international servicing command-line options to recreate the Lang.ini file based on any language-pack updates.
segment.target: You can use DISM international servicing command-line options to recreate the Lang.ini file based on any language-pack updates.

segment.source: Do not manually modify the Lang.ini file.
segment.target: Do not manually modify the Lang.ini file.

segment.source: To learn more, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: To learn more, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: If you deploy a multilingual image, or need to apply a specific language pack to a Windows image for a specific device, you can add the language pack by using Windows Setup and an unattended answer file.
segment.target: If you deploy a multilingual image, or need to apply a specific language pack to a Windows image for a specific device, you can add the language pack by using Windows Setup and an unattended answer file.

segment.source: The language pack must be added to the image before international settings can be configured.
segment.target: The language pack must be added to the image before international settings can be configured.

segment.source: For more information about how to add a language pack to an answer file, see Add a Package to an Answer File.
segment.target: For more information about how to add a language pack to an answer file, see Add a Package to an Answer File.

segment.source: To add a language pack and configure international settings, use the WindowsPE configuration pass to add the language pack and other configuration passes to configure international settings.
segment.target: To add a language pack and configure international settings, use the WindowsPE configuration pass to add the language pack and other configuration passes to configure international settings.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure International Settings in Windows
segment.target: For more information, see Configure International Settings in Windows

segment.source: Note If language and locale settings are specified in an answer file, those settings overwrite any previous default.
segment.target: Note If language and locale settings are specified in an answer file, those settings overwrite any previous default.

segment.source: For example, if you first change the default setting to FR-FR by using the DISM command-line tool on an offline image and then later apply an unattended answer file that specifies EN-US as the UI language, EN-US will be the default UI language.
segment.target: For example, if you first change the default setting to FR-FR by using the DISM command-line tool on an offline image and then later apply an unattended answer file that specifies EN-US as the UI language, EN-US will be the default UI language.

segment.source: Use Setup to install the language packs that are in the distribution share.
segment.target: Use Setup to install the language packs that are in the distribution share.

segment.source: To learn more, see Add Multilingual Support to a Windows Distribution or Add Multilingual Support to Windows Setup.
segment.target: To learn more, see Add Multilingual Support to a Windows Distribution or Add Multilingual Support to Windows Setup.

segment.source: Add or remove languages offline
segment.target: Add or remove languages offline

segment.source: Here's how to add and remove languages on an offline image (install.wim).
segment.target: Here's how to add and remove languages on an offline image (install.wim).

segment.source: To save space, you can remove English language components when deploying to non-English regions.
segment.target: To save space, you can remove English language components when deploying to non-English regions.

segment.source: You'll need to uninstall them in the reverse order from how you add them.
segment.target: You'll need to uninstall them in the reverse order from how you add them.

segment.source: Mount the images
segment.target: Mount the images

segment.source: Mount the Windows and Windows RE images.
segment.target: Mount the Windows and Windows RE images.

segment.source: The Windows RE image file is part of the Windows image.
segment.target: The Windows RE image file is part of the Windows image.

segment.source: Add a language
segment.target: Add a language

segment.source: Add the language to Windows.
segment.target: Add the language to Windows.

segment.source: You can use either the /Add-Package or /Add-Capabilities commands to add the capabilities.
segment.target: You can use either the /Add-Package or /Add-Capabilities commands to add the capabilities.

segment.source: For packages with dependencies, make sure you install the packages in order.
segment.target: For packages with dependencies, make sure you install the packages in order.

segment.source: For example, to enable Cortana, install: lp.cab, then Basic, then TextToSpeech, then Speech, in this order.
segment.target: For example, to enable Cortana, install: lp.cab, then Basic, then TextToSpeech, then Speech, in this order.

segment.source: If you’re not sure of the dependencies, it’s OK to put them all in the same folder, and then add them all at once using the same DISM /Add-Package command.
segment.target: If you’re not sure of the dependencies, it’s OK to put them all in the same folder, and then add them all at once using the same DISM /Add-Package command.

segment.source: After adding the language pack, verify that it's in the images.
segment.target: After adding the language pack, verify that it's in the images.

segment.source: Add any other capabilities, such as fonts, required for that region.
segment.target: Add any other capabilities, such as fonts, required for that region.

segment.source: To learn more, see Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).
segment.target: To learn more, see Features On Demand V2 (Capabilities).

segment.source: When you add languages to Windows, when possible, add them to WinRE to ensure a consistent language experience in recovery scenarios.
segment.target: When you add languages to Windows, when possible, add them to WinRE to ensure a consistent language experience in recovery scenarios.

segment.source: This requires a matching version of Windows and the Windows ADK.
segment.target: This requires a matching version of Windows and the Windows ADK.

segment.source: Note, Windows RE now requires the WinPE-HTA package, this is new for Windows 10.
segment.target: Note, Windows RE now requires the WinPE-HTA package, this is new for Windows 10.

segment.source: After adding the packages, verify that they're in the image.
segment.target: After adding the packages, verify that they're in the image.

segment.source: Example output from /Get-Packages: Package Identity : Microsoft-Windows-WinPE-Rejuvfr-fr ... fr-FR~10.0.9926.0 State : Installed
segment.target: Example output from /Get-Packages: Package Identity : Microsoft-Windows-WinPE-Rejuvfr-fr ... fr-FR~10.0.9926.0 State : Installed

segment.source: Add a language interface pack (LIP)
segment.target: Add a language interface pack (LIP)

segment.source: Add the LIP and desired/available capabilities to the Windows image.
segment.target: Add the LIP and desired/available capabilities to the Windows image.

segment.source: Some regions don't have any related capabilities, while others have partial or complete sets.
segment.target: Some regions don't have any related capabilities, while others have partial or complete sets.

segment.source: After adding the packages, verify that they're in the image.
segment.target: After adding the packages, verify that they're in the image.

segment.source: Add any other capabilities, such as fonts, required for that region.
segment.target: Add any other capabilities, such as fonts, required for that region.

segment.source: Verify that they're in the image.
segment.target: Verify that they're in the image.

segment.source: Remove a language
segment.target: Remove a language

segment.source: To save space, you can remove languages from an image.
segment.target: To save space, you can remove languages from an image.

segment.source: You'll need to uninstall them in the reverse order from how you add them.
segment.target: You'll need to uninstall them in the reverse order from how you add them.

segment.source: You can't remove a capability that other packages depend on.
segment.target: You can't remove a capability that other packages depend on.

segment.source: For example, if you have the French handwriting and basic capabilities installed, you can't remove the basic capability.
segment.target: For example, if you have the French handwriting and basic capabilities installed, you can't remove the basic capability.

segment.source: This will fail.
segment.target: This will fail.

segment.source: You can use either the DISM /Remove-Package or DISM /Remove-Capability command to remove a capability, and either /DISM /Get-Packages or DISM /Get-Capabilities to verify that they're no longer in the image.
segment.target: You can use either the DISM /Remove-Package or DISM /Remove-Capability command to remove a capability, and either /DISM /Get-Packages or DISM /Get-Capabilities to verify that they're no longer in the image.

segment.source: It's also OK to just remove the language pack without removing the language capabilities.
segment.target: It's also OK to just remove the language pack without removing the language capabilities.

segment.source: One week after the user completes OOBE, if the user hasn't added the language to their input language list, Windows automatically cleans out the unused language capabilities.
segment.target: One week after the user completes OOBE, if the user hasn't added the language to their input language list, Windows automatically cleans out the unused language capabilities.

segment.source: Remove the Windows RE optional components.
segment.target: Remove the Windows RE optional components.

segment.source: After removing, verify that they're no longer in the image.
segment.target: After removing, verify that they're no longer in the image.

segment.source: Known issue: If you've removed the English language pack, in Windows 10 Build 10240, you'll need to boot the image into audit mode, and use the command: to repair issues with Windows 32-bit apps.
segment.target: Known issue: If you've removed the English language pack, in Windows 10 Build 10240, you'll need to boot the image into audit mode, and use the command: to repair issues with Windows 32-bit apps.

segment.source: For an example of how to do this with a script, see Lab 2a: Answer files: Update settings and run scripts.
segment.target: For an example of how to do this with a script, see Lab 2a: Answer files: Update settings and run scripts.

segment.source: Reinstall apps (required whenever adding languages)
segment.target: Reinstall apps (required whenever adding languages)

segment.source: If your image includes inbox Windows apps obtained before August 18, 2015, remove them.
segment.target: If your image includes inbox Windows apps obtained before August 18, 2015, remove them.

segment.source: The following example shows you how to remove the Get Started inbox app.
segment.target: The following example shows you how to remove the Get Started inbox app.

segment.source: Repeat these steps for each of the inbox apps (with the exception of AppConnector) by substituting the appropriate package.
segment.target: Repeat these steps for each of the inbox apps (with the exception of AppConnector) by substituting the appropriate package.

segment.source: Note To remove all of the apps at once, run the sample script: “Removeappsinofflineimage.cmd” from the Lab Pre-requisites.
segment.target: Note To remove all of the apps at once, run the sample script: “Removeappsinofflineimage.cmd” from the Lab Pre-requisites.

segment.source: Re-install the apps.
segment.target: Re-install the apps.

segment.source: The following example shows you how to reinstall the Get Started inbox app.
segment.target: The following example shows you how to reinstall the Get Started inbox app.

segment.source: Repeat these steps for each of the inbox apps (with the exception of AppConnector) by substituting the appropriate package.
segment.target: Repeat these steps for each of the inbox apps (with the exception of AppConnector) by substituting the appropriate package.

segment.source: Classic Windows applications: You'll often need to reinstall these too, as they often include language-specific files that are chosen at installation.
segment.target: Classic Windows applications: You'll often need to reinstall these too, as they often include language-specific files that are chosen at installation.

segment.source: You won't be able to update these using offline servicing; instead you'll need to recapture the image or create a separate provisioning package for the Classic Windows application.
segment.target: You won't be able to update these using offline servicing; instead you'll need to recapture the image or create a separate provisioning package for the Classic Windows application.

segment.source: For installations managed by Windows Setup or distribution shares, update the language list
segment.target: For installations managed by Windows Setup or distribution shares, update the language list

segment.source: This is only required if you're distributing multilingual Windows Setup media, or distributing Windows through a share.
segment.target: This is only required if you're distributing multilingual Windows Setup media, or distributing Windows through a share.

segment.source: Recreate the lang.ini file.
segment.target: Recreate the lang.ini file.

segment.source: The lang.ini file in C:myDistributionsources should look similar to the following:
segment.target: The lang.ini file in C:myDistributionsources should look similar to the following:

segment.source: Review the default international settings in the Windows image by using DISM.
segment.target: Review the default international settings in the Windows image by using DISM.

segment.source: For example, you should see output similar to the following:
segment.target: For example, you should see output similar to the following:

segment.source: Change the default language
segment.target: Change the default language

segment.source: Set the default Windows language to match the preferred language for your customers.
segment.target: Set the default Windows language to match the preferred language for your customers.

segment.source: Unmount the images
segment.target: Unmount the images

segment.source: Unmount the Windows RE and Windows images.
segment.target: Unmount the Windows RE and Windows images.

segment.source: The Language-Pack Removal Task
segment.target: The Language-Pack Removal Task

segment.source: In Windows 10, the language pack removal task runs on all Windows editions.
segment.target: In Windows 10, the language pack removal task runs on all Windows editions.

segment.source: However, any languages that are selected by users in the language preferences section of the control panel are not removed.
segment.target: However, any languages that are selected by users in the language preferences section of the control panel are not removed.

segment.source: Users can choose to run multiple languages and any language packs that are not used by the user are removed from the computer.
segment.target: Users can choose to run multiple languages and any language packs that are not used by the user are removed from the computer.

segment.source: Also, any language pack that is installed by a user is not removed.
segment.target: Also, any language pack that is installed by a user is not removed.

segment.source: Running the Sysprep tool resets the language-pack removal clock.
segment.target: Running the Sysprep tool resets the language-pack removal clock.

segment.source: The clock will not start again until the next time OOBE runs and the computer is restarted.
segment.target: The clock will not start again until the next time OOBE runs and the computer is restarted.

segment.source: If you customize your Windows image, consider booting to audit mode to make your customizations.
segment.target: If you customize your Windows image, consider booting to audit mode to make your customizations.

segment.source: The language pack removal task will not be started when you boot to audit mode.
segment.target: The language pack removal task will not be started when you boot to audit mode.

segment.source: For more information about audit mode, see Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.
segment.target: For more information about audit mode, see Boot Windows to Audit Mode or OOBE.

segment.source: You can also update your Windows image offline without booting the image.
segment.target: You can also update your Windows image offline without booting the image.

segment.source: For more information, see Service a Windows Image Using DISM
segment.target: For more information, see Service a Windows Image Using DISM

segment.source: Using the setting in the Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup component does not skip the language-pack removal task.
segment.target: Using the setting in the Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup component does not skip the language-pack removal task.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The language-pack removal task does not remove LIPs.
segment.target: The language-pack removal task does not remove LIPs.
